resources.string: In this dungeon you will face many dangerous foes. You will need to use all of your strength and abilities to make it through. However while the danger is real and constant threat there is also great treasure to be earned for those brave enough to seek it. Shall you continue adventurer?

You go further into the decrepit dungeon. The smell of mildew permeates the torch lit corridors, and you hear a soft squelch as you move across the moss covered ground. You begin to almost become calm as you round a corner and see glowing red eyes in the darkness. You ready your weapons and prepare for the encounter.

Having bested your first foe. You continue undaunted forward. The squelching continues, and turns into wet sloshing as you begin to start moving through first ankle deep and then eventually knee deep water. Bright blue flickering lights dance around you

Thank you for downloading Quest Manager!

Your goal, hero, is simple: complete enough Quests to both raise your Productivity Level high enough that you can conquer the Dungeon of Responsibilities, and simultaneously, thanks to the prior motivation, become better at completing your tasks in the real world!

Below you will find explanations of how each of the screens of this app functions.

We wish you luck, hero!

You guys should let me know if there is anything I should put here that is not covered by the other sections.

The home screen can be thought of as your adventuring hub.

At the top you will see your current Main Quest (set on the Quest screen).

Next to your character image is your Name (as entered when you first made your character; it unfortunately cannot be changed) and your currently set Title. Titles are earned as achievements for completing specific tasks or a certain number of tasks (see the Profile Screen section of this page).

Below that is your Level, Power, and EXP (experience points). Power and EXP are both increased by completing Quests. Earning enough EXP ups your Level. It represents how much your productivity has increased!

Power is used to enter the Dungeon. To do well in the Dungeon, you will want to increase your stats. This is done by leveling up (see the Profile Screen), and by buying weapons with the money you earn from the Dungeon at the Shop.

At the bottom are buttons to take you the Quest, Profile, Shop, and Dungeon screens, which each have their own sections on this page if you have questions about them.

The Quest Screen is where you make and view Quests; aka, the tasks you have to complete. It is divided into three sections: Current Quests, Daily Quests, and Completed Quests.

The Current Quests tab lets you see the tasks you have signed up for and have yet to complete. Every Quest has a Name, Description, Due Date, Due Time, and Difficulty (from 1 to 5). You can make a new Quest by pressing the New Quest button at the bottom of this screen.

If you click on a Quest in the list, you can edit it, delete it, move its position, or mark it as complete. The Quest you have at the top of your list will be set as your Main Quest and appear at the top of the Home Screen. Completing a Quest will earn you EXP (amount depending on its Difficulty) and move it to the Completed Quests tab, where you can view everything you have accomplished :)

Daily Tasks are chores that are auto-generated and refresh every day. They are reminders to do things like eat, drink water, take care of your personal hygiene, keep your space clean, and get some rest. You can add some of your own as well with the New Daily Quest button. They are a smaller but reliable source of EXP and Power, and they are important to do, so be sure to do them and check them off the list!

The Profile Screen is where you can view your player stats and achievements.

Stats are earned by increasing your Productivity Level via EXP from finished Quests. They improve your performance in the Dungeon, so assign your points wisely!

Maybe have a description of each stat here? Unless that will be on the profile screen.

Achievements are earned from completing specific tasks, or a certain number of tasks. Each achievement gets you a Title that you can set to appear alongside your name on the Home Screen.

The Shop Screen is where you spend the money you earn in the Dungeon.

The weapons you buy here can give an additional boost to your stats, which are viewable on the Profile Screen. You can also buy potions that will temporarily boos your stats.

The Dungeon of Responsibilities is where you put your Power to use. Entering will inevitably lead to an encounter with a monster!

The monster will attack you (or at least try to) on its turn, lowering your Power. Do not let your Power get to 0, or you will lose some of your money as you flee!

On your turn, you can either attack the monster, defend yourself so you take less damage, power yourself up to make your next attack hit harder, or retreat to save your Power and try again next time.

Defeating a monster will earn you money that can be spent on the Shop Screen, and it will allow you to progress deeper into the dungeon.
